Best game of all time.

Gameplay: Open world simulation. You can throw cans at guards, use a crowbar to destroy nearly everything, shoot explosives and enjoy the explosion, and so much more cool stuff! xD 

Graphics: As a fairly old game, the graphics are still stunning! So much detail gives you a very good simulation feel! :D

Controls: W,A,S,D,E,CTRL,SPACE (M1,M2) Just make sure you have these keys and u will enjoy!! 

System Requirements: Have 2gb ram pc? Plays fine! 1.5 ghz? Still fine! I bet even a potato can run this! xD 

Story: Very complex and thorough with the language usage!! The story comes calm to ACTION STRAIGHT AWAY!!


Overall: 8/10 
(Easy controls, Potato playable, Story Rich, Pretty disturbing but fine violence) [RECOMMENDED]

graphics arnt very good

I only have about 6 hours of this game, but I've so enjoyed the amount of time I've spent with it I feel this kind of review is warrented. If you have the chance, GET THIS GAME. It's more worth then I can say.

UPDATE: Beat the game, up everything good I said by like 10x :)

[b] Graphics [/b]

For a game released in 2004, the graphics in this game are great. Because I'm playing this game in 2018, and coming from high definition games released just this year make me a little blind to the work that has gone in. My favorite thing about the graphics in this game is that no area is left untouched. A lot of games struggle to properly construct certain areas, patches of grass, ect, but Half-Life does this well.



[b] Gameplay [/b]

My all time favorite campaign is Halo 5 (I know I'm a nerd,) and this game nearly gets there. A lot of games struggle to keep long storylines fresh and interesting without making anything too predicatable, and I can safely say this is not one of those games.

The puzzle aspect of this game is my favorite. Unlike other FPS campaigns, there are moments in the storyline where you need to stop, think, and sometimes try mulitple things before you finally find the answer. However, all of the puzzles become clear when you really step back and look at the situation, thanks to hints from the developers. 

I challenge you to play through the entire game without using any outside source :)



[b] Music [/b]

There isn't a whole lot, but the music helps some areas get more intense (especially in the mines.)


[b] Ending: WARNING- SPOILERS [/b]

THIS SEGMENT OF MY REVIEW CONTAINS SPOILERS. I WANT OTHERS TO SEE WHAT I THOUGHT OF THE ENDING TO THE GAME, SO IF YOU DO NOT WANT TO KNOW ABOUT THE ENDING PLEASE STOP READING HERE.

I'M NOT JOKING.

Ok so the ending somewhat confused me. I guess that part of it could be because I didn't play the original Half-Life game, but usually I'm pretty good at peices parts of a plot together. Breaching the citadel was fun enough, but I feel that only allowing players to use the gravity gun (which is overpowered as absolute fuck) isn't as fun as allowing us to blast the combine with the many differnet weapons we've aquired over the game. 

I can honestly say I didn't really enjoy the very end of the game. If I didn't enjoy the rest of it so much, I think I would give the game as a whole a bad review (but I did so here I am :) Destroying the portal was relatively easy and fun. However, when that boi pops out of the portal, (who isn't even really a boy, it looked like he wasn't real, some part of a spiritual world maybe?) The confusion started. He began talking about other people watching you, and wanting your services. This somewhat made me think about who Dr. Freeman really is, and where he came from. I also didn't liek how it left you hanging. Did Gordon die? What happened to Alex? 

Anyway, overall I enjoyed the game. I plan on playing Episode 1 to really see how it ended, and then from there I'll porbably end up changing my review. If you want to add me to talk about it, just drop a comment on my page and I'll be happy to discuss.

Es un juego único y revolucionario que ha influenciado gran parte de los shooters actuales, además de que ha envejecido genial. Tiene partes plataformeras, zonas estilo "survival horror", las transiciones entre zonas son realistas (aunque a mi personalmente es lo que menos me ha gustado), hay una buena variedad de armas y las físicas están muy conseguidas.

Todo el mundo debería jugarlo aunque sea una vez en la vida.

那些说半条命3的，别想了，g胖不会数3，就连游戏价格36CNY的“3”都是员工写的，你们别期望g胖会数3了，除非g胖现在重新开始学数学，那么过9999年可能会出

其实吧，等到骑砍2发售时，半条命3就发售了，可惜他们都一样，永远都不会发售了...

G胖会数3之时，家祭无忘告乃翁。              ——（宋）陆游——一个从宋代就开始等半条命3发售的著名诗人

Наконец-то прошел. В 2018 то.

Ah, Half-Life 2. What can I say about this game that hasn't already been said? One of the finest games to ever be created, but also one of the saddest creative processes ever. Yes while this is certainly a supremely great series, it will forever remain unconcluded and unfinished due to Valve's politics and other pursuits.
Unlike many, I'm not sad or angry that we'll never get a continuation to Half-Life 2's story beyond Episode 2, I'm just happy I got to play through such an engrossing and gripping story (thank you Marc Laidlaw) and such a fun and immersive game (thank you to everyone who worked on HL2).
Unless you've been living under a rock for 13+ years, you already know this is worth a buy and a playthrough, so you don't need me to tell you the ins and outs.

Thiccc (3 C's!!!)

Para mí, es el mejor juego de Valve y uno de los mejores juegos de la historia.
Es increíble como un juego de tantos años sigue siendo tan bueno a día de hoy.
Totalmente adelantado a su época.
El juego es divertido con mecánicas y puzles muy originales.
Una interacción con el escenario y unos personajes muy bien desarrollados que te harán meterte en el papel del personaje.
Las animaciones faciales son inmejorables.
Totalmente distinto al primero y mucho mejor en todo.
Bastantes horas de juego que se pueden alargar si quieres sacarte todos los trofeos.
Una historia muy bien contada y que refleja las consecuencias de ese accidente en Black Mesa.
Muestra cómo reaccionó y se adaptó la humanidad al darse cuenta de que no eran los únicos en el universo... Al darse cuenta de que no había un único universo.
Una banda sonora que da más epicidad a los combates.
Pocas veces he disfrutado tanto con un videojuego como con Half-Life 2.
Aunque, a pesar de todo, sigue teniendo uno que otro bug en un punto específico. (No afecta en nada a la historia, es simplemente un botón que no funciona y hay que cargar la partida guardada anteriormente y ya).
No es necesario jugar al primero para jugar a este, pero si es altamente recomendable porque entenderás mejor la historia y las referencias. Culminando en una mejor experiencia de juego.
Reafirmo: El mejor juego de Valve y uno de los mejores de la historia.

How to make Chapter Ravenholm interesting

Step 1: Bring the Harmless Rollermine (Dog's Ball)
Step 2: Carry it around and don't lose it (Always quicksave if u messed up)
Step 3: Avoid explosions like Oil Barrel to prevent the Rollermine exploding 
Step 4: ????
Step 5: Profit, enjoy tossing it around on the zombies 

(Note: Zombies and Headcrabs are always gonna target the Rollermine first)

まずSteam始めたらこのゲームってぐらい、原点にして頂点のゲーム。
前作のHalf－Lifeはやってもやんなくてもどっちでもいいと思います。
このゲームを買うなら、Valve社が出しているゲームが全て手に入る、Valve Complete Packをを買いましょうセール時はくそ安くなるので。

ゲイプを崇めよ。
